description: one of a pair of ornaments,  bats, cloud symbols with character, \'shou\'; gold.
text: Gold has been used by the Chinese for personal ornaments since the Shang dynasty. Because the Chinese word for bat (<I>fu<I>) sounds the same as the word for happiness, the bat became extremely popular as an auspicious motif. Emblematic of joy and happiness, bats can be found in nearly all of the decorative arts of the late Ming and Ch'ing dynasties and they were extremely popular as motifs in women's clothing, jewelry and costume accessories.
title: Ornament in the Form of Bat, one of a pair
